facts.text: The video was shot on August 17, 1991, at GMT Studios in Culver City, CA—not a real high school gym!
Director Samuel Bayer drew inspiration from 1979 films Over the Edge and Rock 'n' Roll High School.
Kurt Cobain aimed to write "the ultimate pop song" by ripping off the Pixies' soft-loud dynamics.
The title comes from deodorant! Kathleen Hanna spray-painted "Kurt smells like Teen Spirit" on his wall.
Extras were recruited via flyers: 'Adapt a high school persona—preppy, punk, nerd, jock!'
The cheerleaders' uniforms feature anarchist 'A' symbols.
This is the only Nevermind song co-credited to all three members.
Dave Grohl's drum beat was inspired by disco (yes, really).
The band and extras were genuinely exhausted and angry during filming.
Kurt hated the first edit and re-cut it himself to add more chaos.
The janitor is actor Tony De La Rosa, who appeared in many '90s videos.
Lyrics like 'mulatto, albino, mosquito, libido' were intentionally nonsense.
The main riff is similar to Boston's 'More Than a Feeling'.
Kurt's guitar from this video sold for $4.5 million in 2022.
'Weird Al' parodied it—Cobain said that meant they'd made it.
Over 2 billion views and counting—grunge forever!
